instances.text: THTR_V 443-A_001 - Women in Theatre and Film (A)
THTR_V 448-B_001 - Directed Studies in Theatre Theory and Practice (B)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Permission of the Department is required to enroll in this course. Term 2, 3 credit directed study.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding waitlist section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students wishing to take 499A must be registered in at least ONE of the following courses in the same term: THTR 405, 406, 407, 408, 450, 452, 454, 456, 462, 505, 506, 507, 508. Permission from an instructor is required to register for this course.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Registration will be reviewed and should students not meet the eligibility (not have the pre-reqs), they will be de-registered.

instances.text: UFOR_V 402-201 - Urban Forestry Administration, Policy and Law
UFOR_V 420-201 - Ecology of Urban Green Infrastructure
UFOR_V 449-C_201 - Directed Studies in Urban Forestry (C)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Registration in VISA 475 is by permission of instructor.
STEP ONE:
Please email phillip.mccrum@ubc.ca with your full name and UBC student number, and a few sentences explaining your interest in taking the course. VISA 475 is an experiential learning course dedicated to planning and executing the annual BFA/BA Visual Art graduating exhibition, which takes place in April 2025.
STEP TWO:
Add yourself to the VISA 475 waitlist.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: VISA 479: Performance Actions and Approaches engages a practice-based learning methodology to collectively investigate the activist nature of performance art practices and the varying use of scores as an approach for performance actions. This course looks at how multi-sensory interventions into space shift how we move, hear, see, feel, and exist in relation to others and focuses predominantly on the work of contemporary Indigenous and Black performance artists.

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
